name: Michael Jackson
description:
'''Michael Joseph Jackson''' (August 29, 1958 â€“ June 25, 2009) was an American singer, songwriter, dancer, and philanthropist. Dubbed the "'''King of Pop'''", he is widely regarded as [[Cultural impact of Michael Jackson|one of the most culturally significant figures of the 20th century]]. Over a four-decade career, [[List of Michael Jackson records and achievements|his musical achievements]] broke [[Timeline of African-American firsts|American racial barriers]] and made him a dominant figure [[Michael Jackson fandom#Global fan presence|worldwide]]. Through [[List of songs recorded by Michael Jackson|his songs]], [[List of Michael Jackson concerts|stages]], and fashion, he proliferated visual performance for artists in [[popular music]], popularizing [[street dance]] moves such as the [[Moonwalk (dance)|moonwalk]], the [[Robot (dance)|robot]], and the [[anti-gravity lean]]. Jackson is often deemed the greatest entertainer of all time.{{refn|group=nb|Attributed to multiple sources:<ref>{{Cite news |last=Villarreal |first=Yvonne |date=June 29, 2009 |title=Remembering Michael Jackson: 'The Greatest Entertainer of All Time' |url=https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-2009-jun-29-et-jackson-tribute29-story.html |access-date=January 16, 2025 |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |date=December 6, 2022 |title=Michael Jackson Was The Most Influential Entertainer Of The 20th Century & Shaped The Future Of Music, Dance & Film |url=https://okmagazine.com/p/michael-jackson-influential-entertainer-20th-century/ |access-date=December 24, 2024 |magazine=[[OK!]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Satariano |first=Adam |date=July 8, 2009 |title=Family, Fans Mourn Jackson at Site of Final Rehearsal |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2009-07-08/family-fans-mourn-jackson-at-site-of-final-rehearsal |access-date=January 16, 2025 |agency=[[Bloomberg News]] |quote="the greatest entertainer that ever lived."}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Bennett |first=Jessica |date=December 31, 2024 |title=The Greatest Live Performer Of Every Decade, 1950-Present |url=https://www.vibe.com/lists/greatest-live-performer-every-decade-1950-present/ |access-date=January 16, 2025 |magazine=[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]] |quote=Widely considered the greatest performer of all time, Michael Jackson}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Ratliff |first=Michaela |date=August 29, 2024 |title='The greatest artist who ever lived': Michael Jackson leaves impact 15 years after death |url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/greatest-artist-ever-lived-michael-195539668.html |access-date=January 16, 2025 |agency=[[Yahoo! News]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |date=June 5, 2010 |title=Michael Jackson Immortalized |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-lists/50-best-michael-jackson-songs-22188/ |access-date=December 25, 2024 |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |quote=Michael Jackson, the greatest pop artist that ever lived}}</ref>}}

The eighth child of the [[Jackson family]], Michael made his public debut at age six as the lead singer of [[the Jackson 5]], one of [[Motown]]'s most successful acts. His breakthrough as a solo artist came with the highly acclaimed album ''[[Off the Wall]]'' (1979). Jackson achieved unprecedented global success with ''[[Thriller (album)|Thriller]]'' (1982), the [[List of best-selling albums|best-selling album in history]]. Its [[short film]]-style [[Michael Jackson music videos|music videos]] for "[[Thriller (song)|Thriller]]", "[[Beat It]]", and "[[Billie Jean]]" redefined the medium as an art form. Jackson followed it with ''[[Bad (album)|Bad]]'' (1987), the first album to produce five US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] number-one singles: "[[I Just Can't Stop Loving You]]", "[[Bad (Michael Jackson song)|Bad]]", "[[The Way You Make Me Feel]]", "[[Man in the Mirror]]", and "[[Dirty Diana]]". ''[[Dangerous (Michael Jackson album)|Dangerous]]'' (1991) and ''[[HIStory]]'' (1995) sought socially conscious themes, and [[Invincible (Michael Jackson album)|''Invincible'']] (2001) became his [[List of best-selling albums of the 21st century|21st-century bestseller]].

From the mid-1980s, Jackson came under public scrutiny due to changes in [[Health and appearance of Michael Jackson|his appearance]], [[Personal relationships of Michael Jackson|relationships]], behavior, and lifestyle. He [[1993 Michael Jackson sexual abuse allegations|was accused]] of sexually abusing the child of a family friend in 1993. In 2005, Jackson [[Trial of Michael Jackson|was tried]] and acquitted of further such allegations and other charges. In 2009, while preparing for [[This Is It (concert residency)|This Is It]], a series of comeback concerts, [[Death of Michael Jackson|he died]] from an overdose of [[propofol]] administered by his personal physician [[Conrad Murray]], who [[People v. Murray|was convicted]] of [[involuntary manslaughter]] in 2011. Jackson's death triggered global reactions, creating unprecedented surges of internet traffic and a spike in his music sales. [[Michael Jackson memorial service|His televised memorial service]], held at the [[Staples Center]] in Los Angeles, is estimated to have been viewed by more than 2.5 billion people.

Jackson is one of the [[best-selling music artists of all time]], with estimated sales of over 500 million records.{{refn|group=nb|The estimates of Michael Jackson's record sales vary up to 1{{nbsp}}billion.<ref>{{cite news |title=Billboard Music Awards 2014: Michael Jackson hologram steals the show |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=May 19, 2014 |access-date=June 30, 2024 |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/michael-jackson/10840106/Billboard-Music-Awards-2014-Michael-Jackson-hologram-steals-the-show.html |archive-date=June 6, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170606193639/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/michael-jackson/10840106/Billboard-Music-Awards-2014-Michael-Jackson-hologram-steals-the-show.html }} {{cbignore}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/new-michael-jackson-song_n_5250500 |title=New Michael Jackson Song, 'Love Never Felt So Good,' Features Justin Timberlake |newspaper=[[HuffPost]] |agency=Reuters |date=May 1, 2014 |access-date=June 30, 2024 |archive-date=September 15, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210915165131/https://www.huffpost.com/entry/new-michael-jackson-song_n_5250500 |url-status=live }}</ref>}} He holds a [[List of Billboard Hot 100 chart achievements and milestones#Most number-one songs|joint-record for a male solo artist]] with 13 ''Billboard'' Hot 100 number-one singles and is the only artist to have a top-ten single in six decades. One of the most-awarded music artists in history, [[List of awards and nominations received by Michael Jackson|Jackson received]] 13 [[Grammy Awards]], the [[Grammy Legend Award]], and the [[Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award]]; 26 [[American Music Awards]]; 12 [[World Music Awards]]; eight [[MTV Video Music Awards]]; six [[Brit Awards]]; and three [[President of the United States|presidential]] honors. He was inducted into numerous halls of fame, including the [[List of Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductees|Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] twice, the [[Songwriters Hall of Fame]], and the [[National Museum of Dance and Hall of Fame|Dance Hall of Fame]]. Having donated an [[Philanthropy of Michael Jackson|estimated $500 million]], Jackson is credited with setting a standard for celebrity charity. In 2024, half of [[Mijac Music|his music catalogue]] was sold to [[Sony Music Publishing|Sony]] for $600 million, the [[List of largest music deals#List of largest music catalog acquisitions|largest music acquisition]] for a single artist.
